channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: White House Distances Trump From Initial Response to Minnesota Killing
item.description: Officials clearly understood that the fatal shooting of a demonstrator posed one of the gravest political threats to President Trump since his inaugur...

item.title: On Venezuela and Greenland, Many Trump Fans Give Him the Benefit of the Doubt
item.description: At least so far, President Trump has managed to bring along even those conservative supporters who are skeptical of foreign interventions.

item.title: Trump’s war on immigration entangles business in PR disaster and the literal site of contested arrests
item.description: In Minneapolis, hotels, restaurants and other businesses have temporarily closed their doors or stopped accepting reservations amid widespread protest...

item.title: The billion-dollar storm? Economists debate how much activity Winter Storm Fern laid waste to
item.description: Economist Jacob Fooks says most estimates suggest severe weather events can cut GDP by 0.5% to 2% annually — $150 billion to $600 billion.

item.title: Target’s incoming CEO breaks silence on Minneapolis violence near HQ—read his full statement
item.description: After weeks of protests urging Target to take a stance against Immigration and Customs Enforcement, Michael Fiddelke sent a video message to employees...

item.title: Under Biden Administration, Justice Dept. Began Examining Ilhan Omar’s Finances
item.description: The inquiry, initiated by the U.S. attorney’s office in Washington, appears to have stalled for lack of evidence.

item.title: As U.S. Warships Get Closer, Iran Ramps Up Threats to Retaliate
item.description: Iran and its militia allies say they will respond aggressively in the region if attacked. A U.S. aircraft carrier and warships are approaching the reg...

item.title: Trump’s own Big Beautiful Bill could add $5.5 trillion to the deficits and help sabotage his plan to ‘grow out’ of the national debt crisis
item.description: Prior to the passage of the One Big Beautiful Bill, Trump's "growth" math stood a chance of closing the gap. Now it's much harder to see it working.

item.title: ‘Keep on dreaming’: NATO’s secretary-general has real talk for EU lawmakers threatening break with Trump
item.description: Mark Rutte said that without the U.S., Europe “would lose the ultimate guarantor of our freedom, which is the U.S. nuclear umbrella. So, hey, good luc...

item.title: Winter Storm Pummels Toronto With Record Snowfall
item.description: Canada’s biggest city got roughly 22 inches, and giant snow banks are unlikely to melt soon because of colder than usual temperatures.

item.title: Why Gen Z Doesn’t Love ‘Harry Potter’
As U.S. Warships Get Closer, Iran Ramps Up Threats to Retaliate
item.description: Iran and its militia allies say they will respond aggressively in the region if attacked. A U.S. aircraft carrier and warships are approaching the reg...

item.title: The Taliban Say They’re Ready to Release U.S. Prisoners. But Which Ones?
item.description: Top Afghan officials say they want two American detainees released “as soon as possible,” but the Trump administration says a third one should be incl...

item.title: Thousands of Flights Canceled Monday After Snowstorm
item.description: Delays and cancellations persisted a day after more than 11,000 flights were canceled. Airports in the Northeastern U.S. were hit the hardest.

item.title: Israel Recovers Body of Ran Gvili From Gaza, Closing a Chapter
item.description: The recovery of Master Sgt. Ran Gvili’s body paves the way for the next stage of the Gaza cease-fire plan, though the path forward is unclear.
